channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: 'Final Fantasy XIV Online' Endwalker expansion arrives on November 23rd
item.description: Endwalker, Final Fantasy XIV Online's fourth expansion pack, is coming out on November 23rd.

item.title: Amazon debuts another free video streaming service, this time in India
item.description: Amazon has launched a new free video service, MiniTV — but it's only available in India, at least for now.

item.title: Android 12 might include big changes to notifications and widgets
item.description: A purported Android 12 interface leak hints at a major visual overhaul as well as new approaches to notifications and widgets.

item.title: Twitter's subscription service might cost $3 per month
item.description: A leak hints that Twitter's upcoming subscription service, Blue, will cost $3 per month with features like Undo Tweets and Collections.

item.title: LG's 2021 soundbars arrive in the US starting at $179
item.description: LG has announced the pricing and availability of its 2021 soundbar lineup for the US.

item.title: President Biden revokes Trump order limiting social media protections
item.description: President Biden has revoked a Trump executive order that let the federal government intervene when companies cracked down on social media posts.

item.title: Hitting the Books: Thank a Swede for saving your life the next time you wreck your car
item.description: asdf

item.title: Rocket Lab's 20th Electron mission ends with second stage failure
item.description: Rocket Lab's 20th Electron mission has ended in failure after the second stage abruptly stopped working.

item.title: Learn to make NFTs of your own art for $20
item.description: One hour of expert content taught by a marketing professional will help you start creating and listing NFTs in the marketplace.

item.title: The Morning After: We reviewed the Samsung Galaxy Book Pro 360
item.description: Another robot is on Mars, and we reviewed Samsung's new laptop.

item.title: Apple Stores in the US will keep mask mandates in place, for now
item.description: Visiting an Apple Store in the US? For now, you'll still need to wear a mask.

item.title: China's Tianwen-1 mission has successfully landed on Mars
item.description: China's Mars mission has successfully reached the planet's surface.

item.title: Apple Music for Android offers more details on upcoming lossless streaming
item.description: Conducting an APK teardown of the latest version of the Apple Music app for Android, 9to5Google found code snippets referencing two different tiers of high-fidelity audio.

item.title: Waymo had to rescue an autonomous van that was confused by safety cones
item.description: Programming a computer to understand and navigate roads designed for human drivers is hard.

item.title: Facebook users bypass misinformation rules with anti-vaccine profile frames
item.description: Three months after the company banned vaccine misinformation, CNBC has found evidence of people using one of Facebook's own features to skirt its policies.

item.title: California governor proposes $7 billion investment in public broadband
item.description: Newsom claims the state will close the digital divide if it's approved.

item.title: Former HTC designer Scott Croyle is reportedly working on Beats at Apple
item.description: Croyle previously oversaw the HTC One M7 and M8, as well as Nextbit Robin.

item.title: Google Home Max is $150 for the first time since Black Friday
item.description: A4C has discounted the smart speaker to $199.95. Using the checkout code “SLICK25,” you can get an additional $49.98 off the Home Max, making it $149.97 before tax and shipping.

item.title: This week's best deals: $100 off Apple's MacBook Air M1 and more
item.description: This week's best tech deals include $100 off Apple's latest MacBook Pro M1 and $100 off the Nanit Pro baby monitoring system.

item.title: Take control of your stress with must-have wearable Apollo Neuro
item.description: The Apollo Neuro uses gentle vibrations to improve your body’s reaction to stress. It helps users sleep, focus and stay calm, with no side effects.

item.title: Nintendo says almost 6 million households bought a second Switch last year
item.description: As if finding a Switch wasn’t already difficult enough during the pandemic.

item.title: What to expect at Google I/O 2021
item.description: We don’t know everything Google has in store for Google I/O 2021, but we have some educated guesses — and a few things we’re hoping against hope to see. Here’s everything we know about the show so far, and what you can expect to learn more about once the event kicks off in earnest.

item.title: Sega considers reviving classics like 'Crazy Taxi' and 'Jet Set Radio'
item.description: Sega is considering reviving multiple classic game franchises, including 'Crazy Taxi' and 'Jet Set Radio.'

item.title: Crypto exchange Binance faces US money laundering probe
item.description: Binance, the world's leading cryptocurrency exchange, is reportedly being probed by the DoJ and IRS amid allegations that it is being used to launder money.

item.title: Eufy's popular budget robovacs reach all-time lows in Amazon's one-day sale
item.description: Anker's Eufy-branded robovacs have dropped to all-time low prices through a one-day Amazon sale, making them easy choices.
